Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, Atty. Artemio Rivera, and USPO Jose Lozada. Defendant is under custody and present in court. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. She waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for trial setting. As to bail, Government requested detention. Defense counsel argued in favor of bail. Diego Alcala for Defendant #3, Atty. Jo-Ann Estades for Defendant #7, and USPO Jose Lozada. Defendants waived the reading of the Indictment and entered pleas of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for further proceedings. As to detention for defendant Natanael Gomez-Willis (3), defense counsel had no evidence to rebut the presumption, but reserved the right to request a reopening of the bail hearing. The Court ordered defendant detained on the basis of risk of flight. As to detention for defendant Mariela Gonzalez-Roman (7), defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The government did not object. The Court imposed bail in the amount of $5,000 unsecured, third party custodial, drug testing and treatment, plus all other standard conditions of release.. (Court Reporter DCR.)
